main event: Unidentified aerial object sighted by multiple civilians in Sheaves Cove, Newfoundland on 27th March 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a star, traveling at a low altitude at high speed, and emitting a bright light that covered the lantern light.
The witnesses reported seeing bright lights in the sky on multiple occasions, with one witness describing the light as a 'blue fireball'.
One witness observed a light in the sky at approximately 18 inches in length, with no sound emitted from the object.
A request was made for a map of the sighting area, investigation of local astronomers, and information on any unusual phenomena in the area that could have caused the sighting.

The report also mentions sightings of similar unidentified lights in October 1952 and April 1953, including observations of unusual phenomena, such as the area becoming very light, lights dropping steadily in a downward direction, and objects traveling three times as fast as falling stars.
